header.title: {{name}} Config
header.subtitle: Configure credentials and callbacks for Telegram Bot.

form.name: Platform Name
form.callbackUrlPlaceholder: Webhook URL will be generated after creation
form.callbackUrlHint: Use the setWebhook API to set this URL as your Bot's Webhook address.
form.botTokenHint: Obtain the Token after creating your Bot via @BotFather, and keep it safe.
form.webhookSecretPlaceholder: Used to verify webhook request source
form.webhookSecretHint: Set the same value via the secret_token parameter when calling setWebhook to verify request authenticity.

guide.title: Telegram Bot Configuration Guide
guide.overviewText: Steps: â‘ Create Bot & get Token â†’ â‘¡Enter Token â†’ â‘¢Click 'Enable'. System auto-configures Webhook!
guide.step1Item1: Search for @BotFather in Telegram and start a chat.
guide.step1Item2: Send /newbot command to begin creating your robot.
guide.step1Item3: Enter a display name and a unique username (ending in _bot) as prompted.
guide.step1Item4: BotFather will return a Bot Token. Copy it for the next step.
guide.step2Item1: Paste the Token into the 'Bot Token' field on the left.
guide.step2Item2: (Optional) Enter a 'Webhook Secret' for enhanced security.
guide.step2Item3: Click 'Save', then click the 'Enable' button in the top right.
guide.step2AutoConfig: After enabling, the system automatically registers the Webhook address with Telegram. No manual setup needed.
guide.step3Item1: Search for your Bot's username in Telegram and start a conversation.
guide.step3Item2: Send any message, and the AI will reply automatically.
guide.step3Item3: To add your Bot to groups, ensure 'Allow Groups' is enabled in BotFather.

dialog.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this Telegram Bot platform? This action cannot be undone.

messages.deleteSuccessMessage: Telegram Bot platform has been deleted

header.title: {{name}} Configuration
header.subtitle: Configure Slack Bot credentials and security settings.

form.name: Platform Name
form.botTokenHint: Get the Bot User OAuth Token from the 'OAuth & Permissions' page of your Slack App.
form.appTokenHint: Generate in 'Basic Information' -> 'App-Level Tokens' (requires connections:write scope).
form.signingSecretHint: Get from 'Basic Information' -> 'App Credentials' to enhance security.

guide.title: Slack Bot Configuration Guide
guide.overviewText: Complete these steps: â‘  Create Slack App -> â‘¡ Enable Socket Mode & get App Token -> â‘¢ Configure Bot permissions & event subscriptions -> â‘£ Install to workspace & get Bot Token.
guide.step1Item1: Visit api.slack.com/apps and click 'Create New App'.
guide.step1Item2: Select 'From scratch', enter App name and select target workspace.
guide.step1Item3: Set display name in 'App Home' and ensure 'Messages Tab' is enabled.
guide.step2Item1: Click 'Socket Mode' in the left menu and turn it on.
guide.step2Item2: Generate an App-Level Token as prompted, ensuring it includes the connections:write scope.
guide.step2Item3: Copy the generated xapp-... Token and paste it into the 'App Token' field on the left.
guide.step3Item1: Add required scopes (e.g., chat:write, im:history) to 'Bot Token Scopes' in 'OAuth & Permissions'.
guide.step3Item2: Enable events in 'Event Subscriptions' and add message.im and app_mention.
guide.step4Item1: Click 'Install to Workspace' and complete authorization.
guide.step4Item2: Copy the 'Bot User OAuth Token' (xoxb-...) and paste it into the 'Bot Token' field on the left.
guide.step4Item3: Once saved, your AI assistant will be ready to respond on Slack.

dialog.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this Slack Bot platform? This action cannot be undone.

header.title: {{name}} Config
header.subtitle: Configure credentials and callbacks for WeCom integration.

form.name: Platform Name
form.corpIdHint: Can be found in 'My Company' - 'Company Information'.
form.agentIdHint: Obtain from the application details page in the WeCom management backend.
form.appSecretHint: Used as credentials for calling WeCom interfaces, keep it safe.
form.tokenHint: Must match the Token in the WeCom callback configuration.
form.encodingAESKeyHint: Used when the message encryption method is compatible/safe mode.
form.callbackUrlPlaceholder: Callback URL will be generated after creation
form.callbackUrlHint: Set this URL as the callback address in WeCom 'Server Configuration'.

guide.title: WeCom Configuration Guide
guide.overviewText: Complete these four steps: â‘  Find CorpID â†’ â‘¡ Obtain AgentId/Secret â†’ â‘¢ Configure server callback (URL/Token/EncodingAESKey) â†’ â‘£ Save and test.
guide.step1Item1: Log in to the WeCom management backend.
guide.step1Item3: Copy the 'CorpID' and paste it into the 'CorpID' field on the left.
guide.step2Item1: Select 'App Management' on the left and open your self-built app.
guide.step2Item2: You can see the 'AgentId' on the app details page.
guide.step2Item3: Click 'Secret' to show or reset, copy and fill into the 'App Secret' field on the left.
guide.step2SecurityText: Keep the Secret safe and do not leak it; use minimum permissions and rotate regularly in production.
guide.step3Item1: In 'App Management' â†’ your app â†’ 'Receive Messages', click 'Set' to enter 'API Receive Messages'.
guide.step3Item2: URL: Copy the Callback URL (read-only) from the left and paste it into the console;
guide.step3Item3: Token: Customize any string and ensure it matches the left field;
guide.step3Item4: EncodingAESKey: Click to generate a 43-character key and copy it to the left field;
guide.step3Item5: Encryption Method: 'Compatible' or 'Safe' mode is recommended.
guide.step3Note: After saving, WeCom will perform URL verification. Ensure your server returns the correct verification response.
guide.step4Item1: URL verification failed: Check if your callback service is accessible from the public internet and if the TLS certificate is valid.
guide.step4Item2: Decryption failed: Confirm the EncodingAESKey is correct and contains no extra spaces.
guide.step4Item3: 403/Permission issues: Confirm the app is enabled and granted required permissions; regenerate Secret if necessary.
guide.bestPracticesItem1: Store Secrets in a key management service (like Vault, KMS) instead of plaintext in code.
guide.bestPracticesItem2: Use different Token/AESKey for different environments (Dev/Test/Prod).
guide.bestPracticesItem3: Rotate Secrets regularly and update server configuration before expiration.

messages.saveSuccessMessage: WeCom platform configuration has been updated

confirm.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this platform?

header.title: {{name}} Config
header.subtitle: Configure credentials and callbacks for DingTalk Bot integration.

form.name: Platform Name
form.callbackUrlPlaceholder: Receiver URL will be generated after creation
form.callbackUrlHint: Fill this URL into the 'Message Receiver URL' in DingTalk Bot configuration.
form.appKeyHint: Found in 'Credentials & Basic Info' of the app details on DingTalk Open Platform.
form.appSecretHint: Found in 'Credentials & Basic Info' on DingTalk Open Platform, keep it safe.
form.robotCodePlaceholder: Unique code for the DingTalk robot
form.robotCodeHint: Obtain from the robot configuration page on DingTalk Open Platform.
form.aesKeyHint: Used to decrypt event messages from DingTalk, obtain from Open Platform.
form.tokenHint: Used to verify event subscription request source, obtain from Open Platform.

guide.title: DingTalk Bot Configuration Guide
guide.overviewText: Complete three steps: â‘  Create app/robot on DingTalk Open Platform â†’ â‘¡ Configure receiver URL and get credentials â†’ â‘¢ Fill information back here and save.
guide.step1Item1: Visit DingTalk Open Platform, log in and enter developer backend.
guide.step1Item2: Click 'App Development' â†’ 'Internal Development' â†’ 'Create App'.
guide.step1Item3: Fill in app name, description, etc., and confirm creation.
guide.step1Item4: In app details, find 'Robot' and click 'Create Robot'.
guide.step2Item1: In robot configuration, find 'Message Receiver Mode' and select 'HTTP Mode'.
guide.step2Item2: Copy the 'Message Receiver URL' from the left and paste it into DingTalk.
guide.step2Item3: In 'Credentials & Basic Info', copy 'AppKey' and 'AppSecret' and fill them on the left.
guide.step2Item4: In robot configuration, copy 'RobotCode' and fill it into 'Robot Code' on the left.
guide.step2Item5: In 'Dev Config' â†’ 'Event Subscription', copy 'AES Key' and 'Token' and fill them on the left.
guide.step2SecurityText: Keep AppSecret, AES Key, and Token safe; they are used for verification and encryption.
guide.step3Item2: Go back to DingTalk, click 'Version Management & Release' â†’ 'Create Version'.
guide.step3Item3: Submit for review; it will be ready after admin approval.

dialog.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this DingTalk Bot platform? This action cannot be undone.

messages.saveSuccessMessage: DingTalk Bot configuration has been updated
messages.deleteSuccessMessage: DingTalk Bot platform has been deleted

header.title: {{name}} Config
header.subtitle: Configure credentials and callbacks for Feishu Bot integration.

form.name: Platform Name
form.callbackUrlPlaceholder: Request URL will be generated after creation
form.callbackUrlHint: Fill this URL into the 'Request URL' in Feishu Bot configuration.
form.appIdHint: Found in 'Credentials & Basic Info' of the app details on Feishu Open Platform.
form.appSecretHint: Found in 'Credentials & Basic Info' on Feishu Open Platform, keep it safe.
form.encryptKeyPlaceholder: Encryption key from Feishu Open Platform
form.encryptKeyHint: Used to decrypt event messages from Feishu, obtain from Open Platform.
form.verificationTokenPlaceholder: Verification token from Feishu Open Platform
form.verificationTokenHint: Used to verify event subscription request source, obtain from Open Platform.

guide.title: Feishu Bot Configuration Guide
guide.overviewText: Complete three steps: â‘  Create app/robot on Feishu Open Platform â†’ â‘¡ Configure request URL and get Encrypt Key/Verification Token â†’ â‘¢ Fill information back here and save.
guide.step1Item1: Visit Feishu Open Platform, log in and enter developer backend.
guide.step1Item2: Click 'Create Custom App', fill in name and description.
guide.step1Item3: Go to app details, find 'Robot' in left menu, and enable robot capability.
guide.step2Item2: Copy the 'Request URL' from the left and paste it into Feishu.
guide.step2Item3: Find 'Encrypt Key' and 'Verification Token' on the page, copy and fill them on the left.
guide.step2SecurityText: Keep Encrypt Key and Verification Token safe; they are used for verification and decryption.
guide.step3Item2: Go back to Feishu, click 'Version Management & Release' â†’ 'Create Version'.
guide.step3Item3: Submit for review; it will be ready after admin approval.

dialog.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this Feishu Bot platform? This action cannot be undone.

messages.saveSuccessMessage: Feishu Bot configuration has been updated
messages.deleteSuccessMessage: Feishu Bot platform has been deleted

form.name: Platform Name
form.passwordPlaceholder: Enter email password or authorization code
form.passwordHint: Gmail/QQ Mail requires app-specific password or authorization code
form.imapPasswordPlaceholder: Enter email password or authorization code

guide.title: Email Platform Configuration Guide (IMAP Receiving + SMTP Sending)
guide.tipMessage: IMAP is for receiving emails, SMTP is for sending emails. Common ports: IMAP SSL=993, SMTP SSL=465, SMTP TLS=587.
guide.section1Step1: Log in to your email service provider account (Gmail / Outlook / QQ Mail, etc.).
guide.section1Step2: Go to 'Account Settings' or 'Security' page, enable IMAP/SMTP service (if required).
guide.section1Step3: If required by the service provider (such as Gmail/QQ), enable two-step verification and create an 'App-specific password'.
guide.section1Step4: Fill in IMAP and SMTP configuration in the left form. If using same credentials, check 'Use Same Credentials for SMTP'.
guide.section1Step5: Click 'Save' in the upper right corner, then test sending and receiving emails.
guide.gmailStep1: Go to Google Account Security Center â†’ Two-step Verification â†’ App-specific Password; confirm IMAP/SMTP is enabled.
guide.gmailStep2: IMAP server: imap.gmail.com, port: 993 (SSL).
guide.gmailStep3: SMTP server: smtp.gmail.com, port: 465 (SSL) or 587 (TLS).
guide.gmailStep4: Username is your Gmail address; password uses app-specific password (same for IMAP and SMTP).
guide.outlookStep1: IMAP server: outlook.office365.com, port: 993 (SSL).
guide.outlookStep2: SMTP server: smtp.office365.com, port: 587 (TLS).
guide.outlookStep3: Username is usually the email address; IMAP and SMTP use same credentials.
guide.qqStep1: Go to QQ Mail Settings â†’ Account â†’ Enable 'IMAP/SMTP Service'.
guide.qqStep2: Get authorization code as password; IMAP server: imap.qq.com, port: 993.
guide.qqStep3: SMTP server: smtp.qq.com, port: 465 (SSL) or 587 (TLS).
guide.qqStep4: IMAP and SMTP use the same authorization code.
guide.troubleshootItem1: Confirm that the service provider has enabled IMAP/SMTP service; Gmail/QQ need to enable in settings and use app-specific password/authorization code.
guide.troubleshootItem2: IMAP: prioritize SSL (port 993); SMTP: recommend TLS (port 587) or SSL (port 465).
guide.troubleshootItem3: Verify that the email address (username) and password are correct, pay attention to case and spaces.
guide.troubleshootItem4: If 'Use Same Credentials' is checked, ensure IMAP and SMTP use the same username and password.
guide.troubleshootItem5: If still failing, check if you need to allow third-party client access in the service provider backend.
guide.moreInfo: More documentation: Official documentation and support pages of each email service provider.

messages.saveSuccessMessage: Email platform configuration has been saved
messages.testSuccessMessage: Both IMAP and SMTP connections are working
messages.testValidationError: Please fill in all required email configuration fields

confirm.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this platform?

douyin.label: Douyin
douyin.title: {{name}} - Douyin Platform Configuration
douyin.subtitle: Configure Douyin Open Platform credentials and callback information.

form.callbackUrlPlaceholder: Callback URL will be generated after platform creation
form.callbackUrlHint: Configure this URL in Douyin Open Platform 'Callback Address' settings.
form.authScopeHint: Separate multiple permissions with commas, e.g., user_info,video.list.

guide.title: Douyin Open Platform Configuration Guide
guide.overviewText: Complete the following four steps: â‘  Register Open Platform account â†’ â‘¡ Create application and get credentials â†’ â‘¢ Configure callback address â†’ â‘£ Save and test.
guide.step1Item1: Visit Douyin Open Platform and complete account registration and entity authentication (if required).
guide.step1Item2: Log in to the console and complete developer information.
guide.step2Item1: Create a new application in the console and note down the App ID and App Secret.
guide.step2Item2: Get Client Key and Client Secret in application settings.
guide.step2Item3: Select and enable the required authorization scope (Scope) according to business needs.
guide.step3Item1: Configure the callback URL in the Open Platform 'Callback Settings': use the read-only callback URL above.
guide.step3Item2: Ensure the server is publicly accessible and correctly handles verification requests.
guide.step4Item1: Callback verification failed: Check if the callback URL is accessible and if the TLS certificate is valid.
guide.step4Item2: Insufficient permissions: Confirm that the required Scope has been enabled and authorized in the Open Platform.
guide.step4Item3: Credential error: Verify that App ID/Secret and Client Key/Secret are entered correctly.
guide.bestPracticesItem1: Store keys in a secure key management service (such as KMS/Vault) to avoid appearing in the code repository.
guide.bestPracticesItem2: Use different callbacks and credentials for different environments (development/testing/production), with minimum authorization as needed.
guide.bestPracticesItem3: Regularly rotate keys and minimize permission scope (Scope).

messages.saveSuccessMessage: Douyin platform configuration has been saved

confirm.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this platform?

integration.title: API Integration Information
integration.authDesc: Add the platform API key in the request header:
integration.messagesDesc: Array of conversation messages, compatible with OpenAI ChatGPT API format
integration.userDesc: Unique identifier of the third-party platform user (required)
integration.visitorRegisterDesc: If you need to pass detailed user information (name, avatar, etc.), you can first call the visitor registration API:
integration.responseHandlingDesc: After calling the chat API, TGO system will return the AI assistant's reply. The third-party platform needs to send the returned reply content to the corresponding third-party user. The response format is compatible with OpenAI ChatGPT API, supporting both streaming and non-streaming responses.
integration.callbackConfigDesc: Configure your callback URL in the 'Callback URL' field on the left. When customer service replies to a message, the system will send a POST request to that address.
integration.callbackUserDesc: Third-party user identifier (corresponds to the user field in the chat API)
integration.responseRequirementDesc: Please ensure the callback URL is publicly accessible and returns HTTP 200 status code to indicate successful receipt.

aiSettings.title: AI Settings
aiSettings.agentsHint: Select AI agents assigned to this platform. Multiple selection supported.
aiSettings.agentsHintDefault: If none selected, all AI agents will be used by default.
aiSettings.modeAssistHint: Human first, AI takes over after timeout.
aiSettings.modeOffHint: Disable AI, only human handles messages.
aiSettings.timeoutHint: Time in seconds before AI takes over when there's no reply. Set to 0 to prevent AI takeover.
